page.title: 07THE FIRE
page.content: IN 1864 THERE WAS A FIRE IN BILLINGHAY WHICH IS NOW CALLED THE GREAT FIRE.IT STARTED WHEN A BLOCKED CHIMNEY BELONGING TO A MAN CALLED MR SCOTT WENT ON FIRE.THE SPARKS FELL ON A THATCHED ROOF.A HIGH WEST WIND WAS BLOWING WHICH CAUSED THE FIRE TO BURN A STACK OF OATS,TWO STACKS OF HAY,A PIG STYE AND SOME MORE STUFF.THE FIRE THEN BLEW ACROSS THE ORCHARD AND ROASTED THE APPLES AS IT WENT ALONG.MR BEE AND MR BARKS HOUSES WERE COMPLETELY DESTROYED.MR NEWTON AND MR FLATTERS PROPERTIES WERE COMPLETELY DESTROYED BY THE FIRE.MR GADSLEY,MR GILBERT,MR WOODS,MR WILKINSON,MR CROFT,MR BETTS,MR SHARPE AND MR PETCHELL LOST PROPERTY.THE FIRE WAS IN HIGH STREET THEN DOWN TO KING STREET THEN TO VICTORIA STREET AND ACROSS WEST STREET.THERE WERE TWO DRY SEASONS JUST BEFORE THE FIRE ON SEPTEMBER 9TH.
